messageBody:
You can also run Weblogic inside Vaj, check out:

http://commerce.bea.com/downloads/weblogic_server.jsp

Down toward the bottom can find:

BEA WebLogic Integration Kit for IBM VisualAge for Java

It's beta, and you want some decent hardware to run it
all on, because this allows you to run Weblogic inside
Vaj.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> From: Mathieu Gervais [mailto:egoine_@...]

> Subject: Re: SV: [junit] Best practice with EJB
>
>
> >From: Ralf Krakowski <ralf.krakowski@...>
> [...]
> >I have heard that this (testing locally and then live) is not nessesary
> >with
> >Visual Age since you can run your appserver within Visual Age...? Is this
> >true?
>
> It's kind of true. You can run the websphere test environment(WTE) inside
> the IDE (vaj). This will provide you an EJB container in your
> personnal dev.
> environment. What is really nice with vaj is that you can change
> the code of
> an EJB live without redeploying anything at all (if you don't change the
> interface). The code just gets updated with the last version when you do
> save, like usual with vaj.
>
> Note that the container inside the WTE does not have the exact
> same behavior
> of the real websphere ejb container. For example, some
> optimizations aren't
> there, which changes the callbacks that get called on your EJB.
>
> Mathieu
